post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body:
Ruqqus is "free from moderator abuse", but isn't free from administration abuse. However, Ruqqus must follow Hillsborough County, NH laws. Therefore, according to the governing law, it could be harassment if he doesn't acknowledge your exile. 

>Governing Law
These terms of service are governed by, and shall be interpreted in accordance with, the laws of the state of New Hampshire. You consent to the sole jurisdiction of Hillsborough County, New Hampshire for all disputes between you and Ruqqus LLC, and you consent to the sole application of New Hampshire state law and United States federal law for all such disputes.

>2009 New Hampshire Statutes
TITLE LXII — CRIMINAL CODE (Includes Chapters 625 - 651-E)
CHAPTER 644 — BREACHES OF THE PEACE AND RELATED OFFENSES
Section 644:4 Harassment.

>I. A person is guilty of a misdemeanor, and subject to prosecution in the jurisdiction where the communication originated or was received, if such person: (f) With the purpose to annoy or alarm another, having been previously notified that the recipient does not desire further communication, communicates with such person, when the communication is not for a lawful purpose or constitutionally protected.
body_html:
Ruqqus is "free from moderator abuse", but isn't free from administration abuse. However, Ruqqus must follow Hillsborough County, NH laws. Therefore, according to the governing law, it could be harassment if he doesn't acknowledge your exile.

Governing Law These terms of service are governed by, and shall be interpreted in accordance with, the laws of the state of New Hampshire. You consent to the sole jurisdiction of Hillsborough County, New Hampshire for all disputes between you and Ruqqus LLC, and you consent to the sole application of New Hampshire state law and United States federal law for all such disputes.

2009 New Hampshire Statutes TITLE LXII — CRIMINAL CODE (Includes Chapters 625 - 651-E) CHAPTER 644 — BREACHES OF THE PEACE AND RELATED OFFENSES Section 644:4 Harassment.

I. A person is guilty of a misdemeanor, and subject to prosecution in the jurisdiction where the communication originated or was received, if such person: (f) With the purpose to annoy or alarm another, having been previously notified that the recipient does not desire further communication, communicates with such person, when the communication is not for a lawful purpose or constitutionally protected.

body:
Devil's advocate: There has to be a way to deal with spammers. ruqqus just isn't big enough to have any yet.

And I don't mean users who repeat themselves a lot or trolls. I mean people and bots who post links to malware or things to purchase that have nothing to do with ideology and everything to do with money building botnets.

Exiling *users* for their words is absolutely has no place on a free speech site.

body:
The Evolutionary Advantages of Playing Victim. Newly published research indicates that people who more frequently signal their victimhood are more likely to lie and cheat for material gain and denigrate others as a means to get ahead. Victimhood signaling is associated with numerous morally undesirable personality traits, such as narcissism, Machiavellianism, a sense of entitlement, and lower honesty and humility.

https://quillette.com/2021/02/27/the-evolutionary-advantages-of-playing-victim/

post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body:
According to the ToS, the guildmaster is tasked with managing the guild, and cm4 is violating his ability to do so. The guild was not created by cm4, and is the intellectual property of the guildmaster. If the administration decides to remove the guild for whatever reason, that is their choice. These are the rules that the creators implemented. Since there is no documentation absolving them, they can be held liable. 

Any decent lawyer could make a case for this and tie in Sec. 230 violations as well. I'm sure if any left leaning publication gave a shit about Ruqqus, the site would be in major trouble, and likely shut down...again. Ruqqus was created as a result of situations similar to this. It's a shame the apple fell so close to the tree.
body_html:
According to the ToS, the guildmaster is tasked with managing the guild, and cm4 is violating his ability to do so. The guild was not created by cm4, and is the intellectual property of the guildmaster. If the administration decides to remove the guild for whatever reason, that is their choice. These are the rules that the creators implemented. Since there is no documentation absolving them, they can be held liable.

Any decent lawyer could make a case for this and tie in Sec. 230 violations as well. I'm sure if any left leaning publication gave a shit about Ruqqus, the site would be in major trouble, and likely shut down...again. Ruqqus was created as a result of situations similar to this. It's a shame the apple fell so close to the tree.

post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body:
In this instance liability can subject to a court's ruling on harassment, wrongful conduct of Sec. 230, and/or violations of their own ToS. It may be their site, but they're legally bound to follow the laws like everyone else. I doubt OP would drag it out in court, but to assume it wouldn't be feasible is ignorant. 

The right to use this site is given under the guise of the ToS, until such privilege is removed due to legalities or violations of the ToS. By agreeing to these terms, they are allowing you to use this site. They are also held to those same ToS, because they made user accounts to access the site, and also agreed to their own ToS. 

Intellectual Property is the product of creation. Ruqqus allows worthy users with creating guilds. Sounds cut and dry.
body_html:

The right to use this site is given under the guise of the ToS, until such privilege is removed due to legalities or violations of the ToS. By agreeing to these terms, they are allowing you to use this site. They are also held to those same ToS, because they made user accounts to access the site, and also agreed to their own ToS.

Intellectual Property is the product of creation. Ruqqus allows worthy users with creating guilds. Sounds cut and dry.

post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body:
No. Sifting through countless court cases is not a rabbit hole I wish to go down. There likely isn't or it's a rarity. 

My commnets are compounded with both civil and criminal arguments. They obviously rely on hypothetically plausible theories, but you do not need a precedence of citations to follow through with this. 

Almost any case that goes to court entails a collection of evidence, and it isn't just the one piece or situation that will rule in the victim's favor. This isn't the first time the administration has been called out for this action, or other potential violations of their own rules. Adding together the accumulation of ToS violations, habitual situations, Sec. 230 status, New Hampshire law, and whatever laws governing OP's place of residence; is enough to warrant speculation into it. And all of this isn't even covering the other off-topic questionable actions this site and its administration have been entangled with. 

No I don't think anything will come of this, and I doubt anyone would venture the grueling task of pursuing this. Legal action is possible, just not likely.
body_html:
No. Sifting through countless court cases is not a rabbit hole I wish to go down. There likely isn't or it's a rarity.

My commnets are compounded with both civil and criminal arguments. They obviously rely on hypothetically plausible theories, but you do not need a precedence of citations to follow through with this.

Almost any case that goes to court entails a collection of evidence, and it isn't just the one piece or situation that will rule in the victim's favor. This isn't the first time the administration has been called out for this action, or other potential violations of their own rules. Adding together the accumulation of ToS violations, habitual situations, Sec. 230 status, New Hampshire law, and whatever laws governing OP's place of residence; is enough to warrant speculation into it. And all of this isn't even covering the other off-topic questionable actions this site and its administration have been entangled with.

No I don't think anything will come of this, and I doubt anyone would venture the grueling task of pursuing this. Legal action is possible, just not likely.

post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body:
It's not exactly censorship though.  It's total exclusion. But the site, as a whole, does not censor. 

The abilities of guilds to exile is more akin to an exercise of freedom of association than one of censorship.

People can speak freely in +general, or by making their own guilds. 

It's sort of like how, while you have freedom of speech in the US, you don't really have freedom of speech in my house. I can exclude you (and along with it, your speech) fro my home.
body_html:
It's not exactly censorship though. It's total exclusion. But the site, as a whole, does not censor.

The abilities of guilds to exile is more akin to an exercise of freedom of association than one of censorship.

People can speak freely in +general, or by making their own guilds.

It's sort of like how, while you have freedom of speech in the US, you don't really have freedom of speech in my house. I can exclude you (and along with it, your speech) fro my home.

body:
interesting.  i see the guilds as more of a open discussion on that topic, rather than a personal area.  my change might increase the number of private guilds, just because people don't want to be bothered.

to follow your analogy, guilds such as +conservative would be a public park, and guilds such as +Dissident001_Home would be set as a private guild, to function as my home.

the problem is when abusive GMs get a hold of a "public interest" guild, and turn it into their home.
body_html:
interesting. i see the guilds as more of a open discussion on that topic, rather than a personal area. my change might increase the number of private guilds, just because people don't want to be bothered.

to follow your analogy, guilds such as +Conservative would be a public park, and guilds such as +Dissident001_Home would be set as a private guild, to function as my home.

the problem is when abusive GMs get a hold of a "public interest" guild, and turn it into their home.

guild.description:
This is where kicked content ends up. 

Content here may be yanked to other guilds.
guild.description_html:
This is where kicked content ends up.

Content here may be yanked to other guilds.
guild.name: general

parent.body:
It's not exactly censorship though.  It's total exclusion. But the site, as a whole, does not censor. 

The abilities of guilds to exile is more akin to an exercise of freedom of association than one of censorship.

People can speak freely in +general, or by making their own guilds. 

It's sort of like how, while you have freedom of speech in the US, you don't really have freedom of speech in my house. I can exclude you (and along with it, your speech) fro my home.
parent.body_html:
It's not exactly censorship though. It's total exclusion. But the site, as a whole, does not censor.

The abilities of guilds to exile is more akin to an exercise of freedom of association than one of censorship.

People can speak freely in +general, or by making their own guilds.

It's sort of like how, while you have freedom of speech in the US, you don't really have freedom of speech in my house. I can exclude you (and along with it, your speech) fro my home.

post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body:
The thing is, users have chosen the GM as their "head of household" so to speak.  The GM is chosen as their representative, because when they join a guild they know who the GM is that has the power to decide on exiles. If they don't like that GM and think he does not represent their interest, they can leave and join another community, or form their own.

It's not like how companies like Twitter or Facebook have near monopolies within their sphere. Within ruqqus, there are no significant barriers to leaving or forming another guild.  Look at how many meme guilds sprung up as alternatives to milkits guilds. Then when klens alt started playing games as GM of one of those guilds, yet another one was formed. (TheMemery, then LeMemery, then LaMemery).
body_html:
The thing is, users have chosen the GM as their "head of household" so to speak. The GM is chosen as their representative, because when they join a guild they know who the GM is that has the power to decide on exiles. If they don't like that GM and think he does not represent their interest, they can leave and join another community, or form their own.

It's not like how companies like Twitter or Facebook have near monopolies within their sphere. Within ruqqus, there are no significant barriers to leaving or forming another guild. Look at how many meme guilds sprung up as alternatives to milkits guilds. Then when klens alt started playing games as GM of one of those guilds, yet another one was formed. (TheMemery, then LeMemery, then LaMemery).

post.title: Can someone please ban captainmeta4 for exile evasion? I have exiled him from my private guild, which he is not an approved contributor yet keeps posting in anyway, and he is posting in my guild despite being exiled. Isn't that a violation of the TOS? I'm being targeted for harrassment, right?

body: Why not make it a toggle? "Do you want to see comments marked 'off-topic?'" It can be a global toggle, or a button a user can click per post "Show off-topic comments"
body_html: Why not make it a toggle? "Do you want to see comments marked 'off-topic?'" It can be a global toggle, or a button a user can click per post "Show off-topic comments"

parent.body:
thanks!! of course that is up for tweaking.  maybe normal points but pinned at the bottom.  the goal is to appease those who want to build a certain type of community, while still allowing EVERYONE to comment on a thread.

im gonna make another long post about this this morning in +ruqqus.
